RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Ea ch $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EYE BE SEEING YOU unhurried early while dropping back to trail, raced two out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied from just off the rail entering the final turn, split rivals while tipping four wide leaving the turn, assumed command soon after straightening for home, and quickly drew clear. THERE GOES MY HERO stalked the dueling leaders from along the rail entering the first turn, commenced his bid from just off the rail entering the final turn, tipped three wide entering the lane, was unable to match strides when tackled by EYE BE SEEING YOU in the drive, but finished willingly two out from the rail in deep stretch to prove second best. JUST MISTY broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of ROSE OF TEXAS entering the backstretch, took a narrow advantage into the final turn, was overtaken soon after entering the lane, and was outfinished late while holding on for a share. ROSE OF TEXAS away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace while racing out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied along the rail entering the final turn, but faded in the late stages. ROLLIE'S SPIRIT away well and stalked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but began to weaken midway through the turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Eye Be Seeing You
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed 4 wide, best

ENTRY.NAME: There Goes My Hero
ENTRY.OWNER: Klimes Helen McDonald Jo-Anne and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Rose of Texas
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Just Misty
ENTRY.OWNER: Claggett Edwin MacPherson Craig and Armstrong Foster
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Rollie's Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EMPEROROFTHENORTH stalked the early pace into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed determinedly three wide in the drive to prove best. HE'S A SAINT away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, rallied along the rail entering the final turn, held a clear advantage into the lane, but was unable to fend off EMPEROROFTHENORTH in deep stretch while proving clearly second best. BUZZINGA KARMA tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide through the final turn to loom a danger, but needed more late while finishing four wide in the drive. MILITARY CROSS broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide between rivals entering the final turn, but was outfinished in the drive. ANDALEIGH trailed the field into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide from the back of the pack entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid while finishing three wide in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Military Cross
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: He's a Saint
ENTRY.OWNER: Scott Robert Long William and McLeod Dan
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Buzzinga Karma
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Andaleigh
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Emperorofthenorth
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $ 16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $20,000, Three Year Old $24,000 (BC Bred $30,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KAPALUA CANDY away well and saved ground through the first turn and controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch, continued to save ground through the final turn while opening a clear advantage, and continued to widen that margin late as much the best. I'M ALL SHOOK UP broke sharply and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide through the final turn, was no match for the winner over the final furlong, but battled gamely two wide in the drive to prove second best. VISENYA away alertly and was taken in hand early and allowed to settle at the back of the field, while saving ground at the rail entering the first turn, commenced her bid two wide from the back of the pack entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive to get up for a share. B C CHRISTIE settled off the early pace while racing three wide into the backstretch, advanced two out from the rail midway to the final turn, rallied two wide through the final turn, but had little to offer late. PROUD CAUSE stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail entering the first turn, saved ground through the final turn, but failed to respond when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Kapalua Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, clear lead, widened

ENTRY.NAME: Proud Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rallied rail, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Visenya
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: B C Christie
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, advanced 1/2, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: I'm All Shook Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 21000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $ 16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.

CLAIM.OWNER: Rycroft Cathy Rycroft Kelly Dale Dennis Perry Tabitha and Benson Sheryle

RACE.FOOTNOTES: VIVA LA VINO stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly three wide in the drive to prove best. WANDALITA stalked the leader from along the rail entering the backstretch, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, and found her best stride while finishing four wide in the drive. BELCARRA PARK rushed to the lead two wide entering the first turn, controlled the pace while one out from the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, maintained her advantage into the lane, but was outfinished late while holding on for a share. REA MEA hopped at the start to get away awkwardly, before chasing the leader through the first turn while racing just out from the rail, tracked the pacesetter two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, but was outfinished in the drive. LASTING LIGHT settled off the early pace while under snug restraint entering the first turn, raced in tight quarters in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. BELLAROO settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Lasting Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Rea Mea
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, tracked rail, rallied inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Wandalita
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bellaroo
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Viva La Vino
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Belcarra Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: led 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 21000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS. Weight, 122 lbs.; Non-winners Of A Race Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, For Each $2,500 To $20,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $32,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIME TICKER settled at the back of a compact field while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, shifted three wide entering the lane, and quickly took command in mid stretch to prove best. COUNTERACT away alertly and pressed the pace from the outside of LOVEABOVEANDBEYOND entering the backstretch, struggled to keep tabs with that rival in the run to the final turn, rallied two wide into the turn, and finished willingly one out from the rail in the drive to prove second best. LOVEABOVEANDBEYOND broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, sprinted clear in the run to the final turn, maintained her advantage into the lane, but was outfinished in the drive while proving best of the rest. ENGLISH BAY TEDDY away well and chased the leaders three wide through the first turn, maintained his position in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but faded in the late going. BACK SHACK chased the leaders four wide into the first turn, continued with a wide trip in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Loveaboveandbeyond
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, clear lead, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Counteract
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: English Bay Teddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, chased 3w, rallied 3w, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Time Ticker
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Back Shack
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4 wide, rallied 4 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, For Each $2,500 To $45,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $57,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPACE broke sharply and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, set sail after the leader two wide entering the final turn, assumed command leaving the turn, and drew clear late under confident handling. DESIRED OUTCOME settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid two out from the rail entering the final turn, and closed steadily two wide in the drive to prove second best. STANFORD NORTH away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, battled into the final turn from the inside of SPACE, was unable to keep tabs on that rival leaving the turn, and faded in the late stages while proving easily best of the rest. DREAMB stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground along the inside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but needed more in the late stages when called upon. SHESBOURBONONICE trailed the field into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon. EBONY EYES settled off the early pace while racing two wide in the run down the backstretch, continued two wide into the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Desired Outcome
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Dreamb
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Stanford North
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Ebony Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Space
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E Danard Don B and Rozenek Conrad
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Shesbourbononice
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed rail, rallied inside, never menaced

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 28 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 28 All owed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ARTISTIC JEWLER away well and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained her position in the run down the backside, tackled the pacesetter while commencing her bid two wide entering the final turn and quickly took command, held a clear advantage into the lane, and widened late under confident handling. MISS THE HYPE broke sharply and stalked the leaders through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, held her position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. ANIMA away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace through the stretch the first time and down the backstretch, was tackled by ARTISTIC JEWLER entering the final turn, was no match for that rival midway through the turn, and faded late while proving best of the rest. DONE THAT unhurried early while dropping back to trail, bided her time at the back of the pack through the second turn and in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but was only able to pass a tiring rival late. RACINO stalked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail through the second turn, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but faded in the stretch drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Racino
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Miss the Hype
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Done That
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Artistic Jewler
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Anima
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail
